title: Bain to Buy Nissin Shares to Go Private in $756 Million Deal
content: Japanese logistics company Nissin Corp. said Bain Capital will buy its shares from shareholders for it to go private through a management buyout, in a deal worth about ¥112 billion ($756 million).

title: Fahmy: US Needs the Gulf Countries More Than It Admits
content: President Trump starts his first official diplomatic mission of his second term with stops here in Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the UAE today.Dalia Fahmy, Director of International Relations & Diplomacy, and Associate Professor of Political Science, Long Island University told Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche about the focus of the trip. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US-China Tariff Pause Doesn’t Change Our Allocation: Koesterich
content: Russ Koesterich, Global Allocation Fund portfolio manager at BlackRock, examines the positive and negative elements of about the US and China agreeing to lower tariffs in a 90-day cool-off period. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: China, US Step Back from Decoupling Brink, Slash Tariffs | Bloomberg The Pulse 05/12
content:
US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products in a dramatic ratcheting down of trade tensions that buys the world’s two largest economies three months to work toward a broader agreement. The combined 145% US levies on most Chinese imports will be reduced to 30% including the rate tied to fentanyl by May 14, while the 125% Chinese duties on US goods will drop to 10%, according to a joint statement and from officials in a briefing Monday in Geneva.

Today's guests: Wei Li, BlackRock Global Chief Investment Strategist, Odile Renaud-Basso, EBRD President, Kyriakos Pierrakakis, Greek Finance Minister.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Decisive Moment’ in Trade Talks Puts China Rally Back on Track
content: China’s stock market investors just got the news they have been hoping for.

title: Pakistani, Indian Stocks Soar as Truce Shifts Focus to Growth
content: Stocks in Pakistan and India rallied as a ceasefire agreement between the two nuclear-armed neighbors calmed markets that had been shaken by military clashes on their border.

title: Trump Vows US Drug Price Cuts of Up to 80% in Industry Blow
content: President Donald Trump said he plans to order a cut in US prescription drug costs by mandating that Americans pay no more than people in countries that have the lowest price.

title: US, China Agree to Lower Tariffs
content: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products, in a move to cool trade tensions and give the world’s two largest economies three more months to resolve their differences. The decision was announced at a briefing by US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Southern Spain Outages Preceded Nationwide Blackout, Report Says
content: Power failures in southern Spain preceded a nationwide blackout that left millions in the dark two weeks ago, according to the most detailed report yet on the events leading up to the debacle.

title: US Stock Futures and Dollar Surge on Tariff Truce: Market Wrap
content: Investors rushed back into US assets, powering a more than 3% surge in S&P 500 futures, after China and the US agreed to cut tariffs and de-escalate a trade war that had sown turmoil in global markets. Treasuries and gold tumbled.

title: ould Tariffs Hurt Hydrogen's Lofty Promises?: BNEF
content: Clean hydrogen had been touted as a key fuel to help the world decarbonize, but enthusiasm for the fuel is waning. BloombergNEF senior research associate Adithya Bhashyam spoke to Lizzy Burden on how uncertainties from President Trump's tariffs could complicate the outlook. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Buy America’ Sweeps Across Global Markets After China-US Talks
content: With the temporary truce between the US and China kicking off another equity rally, American stocks are now trading like Donald Trump’s “Liberation Day” shock never happened.

title: Oil Leads Commodity Rally After US-China Truce as Gold Retreats
content: Oil powered higher with most other commodities, while gold fell, after China and the US agreed to lower tariffs on each other, following a weekend of trade talks.

title: India’s Top Cinema Chain Banks on Bollywood Recovery as Movie-Goers Dip
content: India’s top cinema chain PVR Inox Ltd. is betting on a slew of Hollywood and Bollywood releases to bring back moviegoers after a lackluster year.

title: Investors Are Loving Risk Again as Trade War Cools
content: The dollar is rising, bonds are falling and stocks are up around the globe

title: Trump Tariffs: China, US Agree to Cut Tariffs for 90 Days | The Opening Trade 05/12
content:
The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products, in a move to cool trade tensions and give the world’s two largest economies three more months to resolve their differences. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and the US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer spoke in Geneva following the weekend's trade talks. The combined 145% US levies on most Chinese imports will be reduced to 30% including the rate tied to fentanyl by May 14, while the 125% Chinese duties on US goods will drop to 10%, according to the statement and officials in a briefing Monday in Geneva.

The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US-China Tariff Pause ‘Definitely’ Not What Markets Expected: Shah
content: “The market was definitely not expecting anything as significant as this,” says Seema Shah, chief global strategist at Principal Asset Management, about the US and China agreeing to lower tariffs in a 90-day cool-off period. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Nissan Job Cuts Double to 20,000 in Huge Overhaul, NHK Says
content: Nissan Motor Co. will eliminate 11,000 more jobs than previously planned, NHK reported Monday, as part of a plan to restructure its flailing business.

title: Egypt Signs Long-Term Deal to Increase Imports of LNG
content: Egypt signed a 10-year deal with for a floating liquefied natural gas import terminal, signaling the North African nation’s long-term dependency on fuel imports.

title: US, China to Slash Tariffs in Step Back from Decoupling Brink
content: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products in a dramatic ratcheting down of trade tensions that buys the world’s two largest economies three months to work toward a broader agreement.

title: AstraZeneca Loses Spot as UK’s Most Valuable Company to HSBC
content: AstraZeneca Plc lost its crown as the UK’s most valuable listed company after US President Donald Trump’s plans to lower drug prices sent shares of pharmaceuticals companies lower across the world.

title: Bullish Sign for S&P Flashes With More Stocks Shouldering Rally
content: There are plenty of reasons to doubt the stock market’s recent advance — trade-deal progress is scant, economic data is souring and outlooks from US firms are the worst in years. In spite all of that, one measure, at least, suggests that investor confidence is growing in companies both big and small.

title: US and China Slash Tariffs: Full Press Conference
content:
The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products, according to a joint statement, in a move to cool trade tensions and give the world’s two largest economies three more months to resolve their differences.

The combined 145% US levies on most Chinese imports will be reduced to 30% including the rate tied to fentanyl by May 14, while the 125% Chinese duties on US goods will drop to 10%, according to the statement and officials in a briefing Monday in Geneva. 

US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer delivered a press conference immediately after the announcement. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Dollar Surges, Treasuries Fall as US-China Trade Tensions Ease
content: The dollar soared and Treasuries fell as the trade war between China and the US eased, stoking appetite for risk assets.

title: TA Associates Is Said to Weigh Selling Majority Stake in $1 Billion Accion Labs
content: TA Associates is considering selling its majority stake in Accion Labs Holdings Inc. and seeking a valuation of about $1 billion for the Pittsburgh-based technology company, people familiar with the plan said.

title: Morgan Stanley’s Wilson Warns US Stocks Not Yet in the Clear
content: Sentiment toward the US stock market is improving but it’s too early for investors to sound the all-clear, according to Morgan Stanley strategists.

title: CATL Begins Taking Orders for World’s Top Listing in 2025
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. has started taking investor orders for a Hong Kong stock offering that is likely to be the world’s biggest listing this year.

title: Absa Sees East Africa Property Boom, Eyes Kenya Expansion
content: Absa Group Ltd., South Africa’s third-biggest lender, is seeing surging interest among real estate investors in East Africa and plans to bolster its balance sheet to meet demand for financing.

title: Philippines Midterm Vote Begins As Marcos-Duterte Feud, China Row Flare
content: Counting has begun following the Philippines’ midterm elections, which could decide the political future of impeached Vice President Sara Duterte as she feuds with President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.

title: Trump Truce Leaves India Furious, Pakistan Elated as Risks Loom
content: After four days that saw the worst fighting between India and Pakistan in half a century, as well as some nuclear saber-rattling, Donald Trump on Saturday declared that both countries had reached a “FULL AND IMMEDIATE CEASEFIRE.”

title: Taiwan Conducts First Live-Fire HIMARS Test in Signal to China
content: Taiwan conducted its first live-fire test of the US-made HIMARS multiple-launch rocket systems on Monday, marking a significant step in bolstering its ability to deter a potential Chinese invasion.

title: Trump Vows US Drug Price Cuts of Up to 80% in Industry Blow
content: President Donald Trump said he plans to order a cut in US prescription drug costs by mandating that Americans pay no more than people in countries that have the lowest price.

title: Trump’s Immigration Crackdown Hinges on Small Towns Hooked on Private Prisons
content: Like a growing number of US communities, Torrance County, New Mexico, is convinced its financial survival depends on locking people up.

title: Low-Income US Families Face Growing Gap Between Earnings, Costs
content: There’s a growing gap between what low-income families earn and what it actually costs to live in the US, according to a new study that says headline measures of inflation fail to capture the burden on these households.

title: The Dangers of Trump’s Quick-Fix Deals
content: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: US, China to Slash Tariffs in Step Back from Decoupling Brink
content: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products in a dramatic ratcheting down of trade tensions that buys the world’s two largest economies three months to work toward a broader agreement.

title: Thiam Steps Down as Leader of Ivory Coast Opposition Party
content: Tidjane Thiam stepped down as head of Ivory Coast’s main opposition party after his leadership was challenged in court.

title: Spain’s Defense Champion Indra Bets on Becoming a Tank Maker
content: The chairman of Spain’s largest defense firm has a plan for the country to become a key player in Europe’s arms industry: build tanks.

title: Kurdish Separatist Group PKK Ends 40-Year War Against Turkey
content: A separatist Kurdish group agreed to lay down arms to end a 40-year war for autonomy against Turkey, an historic step that could strengthen Ankara’s aspirations to become a regional powerhouse.

title: Starmer Vows Big Drop in UK Immigration to Counter Farage’s Rise
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he would end the UK’s “experiment in open borders” with tougher plans to curb migration, seeking to head off the growing electoral threat from Nigel Farage’s populist Reform party.

title: Poland to Close Another Russian Consulate Over Sabotage Claims
content: Poland ordered the closure of the Russian consulate in Krakow after saying it has proof that a large fire in the country’s capital last year was ordered by Moscow’s secret services, according to the Polish foreign minister.

title: Pharmaceutical Stocks Tumble on Trump Plan to Cut US Drug Prices
content: Shares of pharmaceutical companies fell across the world after US President Donald Trump said he planned to order a cut in US prescription drug costs to bring them in line with other countries, prompting concern that profits will take a hit.

title: Global Stocks Climb After US, China Agree to Cut Tariffs for 90 Days
Albania’s Premier on Track to Win Unprecedented Fourth Term
content: Albania’s premier is on track to win an unprecedented fourth term as he seeks to finally take the Adriatic country into the European Union and cement its status as a tourist destination.

title: What Outlawed PKK Laying Down Arms Means for Turkey and the Kurds
content: Tens of thousands of people have been killed in the four decades since Kurdish separatist group the PKK took up arms against the Turkish government.

title: India Envoy Rejects US Calls for Mediation in Kashmir Issue
content: A top Indian envoy said the dispute over Kashmir is a bilateral issue with Pakistan, rejecting any external mediation on the matter despite the US saying it wanted to facilitate talks.

title: Hamas Says It Will Free Last Living American Hostage in Gaza
content: Hamas said it will release the last living American hostage held in Gaza after renewed talks with the US over a truce deal with Israel.

title: Trump’s Ukraine Push Comes to a Head With Challenge to Putin
content: Donald Trump’s effort to secure peace in Ukraine is reaching a decisive moment with Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy challenging Vladimir Putin to engage in talks this week.

title: US and China Tout Progress in Trade Talks, Offer Few Details
content: The US and China both reported “substantial progress” after two days of talks in Switzerland aimed at de-escalating a trade war, marking what Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng called “an important first step” toward resolving differences.

title: Australia’s PM Keeps Chalmers, Wong in Roles in Second Term
content: Australia’s Prime Minister Anthony Albanese retained Treasurer Jim Chalmers and Foreign Minister Penny Wong in their portfolios as he unveiled changes to his lineup just over a week after decisively winning an election.

title: Words Are Enough to Give Markets a Roadmap for US-China Success
content: Monday’s moderate market reaction to progress in US-China trade talks at least gave investors a roadmap for how a significant breakthrough might play out.

title: US House to Claw Back Biden’s Climate Law to Fund Trump Tax Cuts
content: US House Republicans plan to help pay for an extension of President Donald Trump’s massive tax cuts by clawing back unused funds from scores of programs and grants in his predecessor’s signature climate law.

title: Japan Rules Out Trade Deal With US That Excludes Auto Tariffs
content: Japan won’t accept any initial trade agreement with the US that excludes an accord on autos, according to Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.

title: Americans Embrace Road Trips as Economic Fears Discourage Flying
content: Kristin Herman and her partner had been planning a European getaway with stops in Paris and Rome, but with the US economy suddenly wobbling, the couple instead drove to Oregon’s nearby redwood forests and Cannon Beach — even camping some nights to save on hotels.

title: After Driving Down Oil, Saudi Arabia’s MBS Looks for Trump Dividend
content: Donald Trump and Saudi Arabia's MBS both want to monetize their relationship. It just might not be in the way Trump had envisaged.

title: Medicaid Work Requirements Sought in Bill to Fund Trump Tax Cuts
content: House Republicans want to impose work requirements on some Medicaid recipients up to 64 years old and impose more costs on some beneficiaries to help pay for President Donald Trump’s planned sweeping tax package.

title: S. Korean Conservatives Choose Right-Winger as Campaign Begins
content: South Korea’s ruling conservatives opted for a right-wing candidate in the mold of ousted leader Yoon Suk Yeol to take on frontrunner Lee Jae-myung as the official campaign for the June 3 presidential election kicked off.

title: Trump Set to Accept Luxury Jet as Gift From Qatar, ABC Says
content: President Donald Trump’s administration is likely to accept a luxury Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet from Qatar’s royal family, in what may be the most valuable gift ever received from a foreign government, ABC News reported Sunday.

title: US, China Agree to Lower Tariffs in Temporary Trade Truce
content: Good morning. Markets breathe a sigh of relief as the US and China agree to a temporary truce in their trade war. Donald Trump vows to cut US drug prices. And the president may get a very luxurious gift from Qatar. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: In Full: Greek Finance Minister on Trade, Loans, Economy
content: Greek Finance Minister Kyriakos Pierrakakis discusses the nation’s plans to repay loans from its first bailout program ahead of schedule, saying “it should be completely behind us by 2031.” In an interview with Oliver Crook, Pierrakakis also talks about the potential trade deal between the US and China, as well as what higher tariffs could mean for the European economy and supply chains. He also speaks about Greece’s economy and defense spending.

title: Carronade’s Gropper on Investing: State of Distressed Debt
content: Carronade Capital Management Managing Partner and Chief Investment Officer Dan Gropper expects the US to be in for a “rough ride.” “If I were today sitting on the board of a major corporation, I’m not sure I’d build my new factory or start a new division or open 14 new restaurants. You’d want to know what’s going to happen with the economy. And so even the uncertainty without the second- and third-order effects that can and will occur from tariffs, even before that happens, I think you’re alread

title: Pierrakakis: Bailout Loans Should Be ‘Behind Us By 2031’
content: Greek Finance Minister Kyriakos Pierrakakis says the nation plans to repay loans from its first bailout program 10 years ahead of schedule. The last repayment of this set of loans was scheduled for 2041, but Pierrakakis tells Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook “it should be completely behind us by 2031.” He adds: “We plan to continue de-escalating our debt. We don’t plan to pass the bill to the next generation as all the previous generations in Greece did.”

title: UniCredit to Start Talks With Rome Over BPM Offer, Orcel Says
content: UniCredit SpA is about to start talks with Italian government officials to clarify a number of aspects linked to the conditions imposed on its takeover offer for Banco BPM SpA, Chief Executive Officer Andrea Orcel said.

content: Get briefed ahead of your morning calls with the latest UK business headlines, key data and market reaction

title: EDP Says It’s Confident US Will Keep Tax Credits for Renewables
content: Portuguese utility EDP SA is confident that tax credits for renewable projects in the US will remain in place under the administration of President Donald Trump, Chief Executive Officer Miguel Stilwell d’Andrade said.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe 05/12/2025
content:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

Today's Guests: Lauren van Biljon, Senior Portfolio Manager at Allspring Global Investments. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US & China Tout Trade Progress, Possible Zelenskiy-Putin Talks
content: Source: Bloomberg, 6:20

title: Trump Expected to Sign Executive Order on US Drug Costs
content: US President Donald Trump said in a social media post that he will sign an executive order mandating Americans pay no more for prescription drugs than people in countries that have the lowest price. The executive order will be signed at 9 a.m. in Washington, according to Trump’s post. Bloomberg’s Katia Dmitrieva reports.

title: US-China Talks Advance, New Russia Sanctions, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 7:11

title: Trump’s Trip to Saudi Arabia: What’s at Stake?
content: US President Donald Trump will visit Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates this Week. Crown prince Mohammed bin Salman is preparing to welcome Trump back in the kingdom with a grand display of pageantry as the two look to monetize their relationship. Bloomberg’s Sam Dagher discusses what to expect from Trump’s trip and what’s at stake for MBS and the kingdom.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Europe: US-China Talks Advance (Podcast)

title: Stocks Rise on US-China Trade Talk Progress: Morning Briefing Europe
content: Good morning. Positive murmurs from the China-US trade talks are boosting stock markets. Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy says he hopes Russia's Vladimir Putin doesn't look for excuses to cancel their planned meeting this week. And Pope Leo calls for a lasting end to hostilities. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: Europe Faces Test as Trump Pushes Putin Meeting
content: Welcome to the Brussels Edition, Bloomberg’s daily briefing on what matters most in the heart of the European Union.

title: Cynics About Trump Tariffs Should Focus on Markets
content: An awful lot is now riding on the administration never having meant a word it was saying.

title: Pan American Silver to Buy Smaller Rival MAG for $2.1 Billion
content: Pan American Silver Corp. agreed to buy smaller producer MAG Silver Corp. in a transaction valued at about $2.1 billion, giving the bigger producer access to a major mine in Mexico.

title: Apple Weighs Raising IPhone Prices in New Lineup, WSJ Says
content: Apple Inc. is weighing raising prices for the iPhone lineup coming out later this year, the Wall Street Journal said, citing people familiar with the matter whom it didn’t identify.

title: The iPhone Is a Nicer Place With Fewer Restrictions After Ruling
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr looks at the impact of the latest ruling ordering Apple to reform its App Store practices.

title: SoftBank Stargate Venture With OpenAI Hits Snags on Tariff Fears
content: SoftBank Group Corp.’s plans to invest $100 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the US have slowed, with economic risks stemming from Washington’s tariffs holding up financing talks.

title: Air-Taxi Startup Vertical Goes Hybrid in Pivot Toward Defense
content: Vertical Aerospace Ltd is building a hybrid variant of its battery-powered air taxi, in a bet that a longer-range aircraft will attract investment from the lucrative defense sector.

title: Mazda Withholds Profit Guidance as Suzuki Dodges Trump’s Tariffs
content: Mazda Motor Co. withheld its annual profit guidance after its short-term future, along with most global carmakers, was muddied by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Xiaomi Shares Drop as Consumers Complain About Marketing of EVs
content: Xiaomi Corp. shares dropped as much as 5.7% in Hong Kong on Monday after a local media report over the weekend that said more than 300 people want to cancel their SU7 Ultra electric vehicle orders on “false advertising” about the design of the vehicle’s hood.

title: Golub-Backed Saudi Firm Starts AI Fund to Drive US-Mideast Ties
content: A Saudi Arabia-based venture capital firm that’s backed by the family office of US billionaire Lawrence Golub is launching a $50 million fund to invest in artificial intelligence startups across the Middle East and the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: AI Drug Firm METiS Considering $200 Million Hong Kong IPO, Sources Say
content: Artificial intelligence-driven drug firm METiS Pharmaceuticals is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong to raise as much as $200 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Amazon-Backed Scale AI Plans Middle East Expansion With New Saudi Arabia Office
content: Scale AI, a startup backed by Amazon.com Inc. that helps companies develop artificial intelligence products, plans to open an office in Saudi Arabia by the end of the year in a broader regional expansion.

title: Activist Dalton Seeks Talks With Fuji Media to Avoid Proxy Fight
content: Dalton Investments’ co-founder James Rosenwald said he wants to avoid a proxy fight with Fuji Media Holdings Inc., calling on the Japanese broadcaster to negotiate a settlement.

title: New Zealand Steps Up Plans to Ban Under-16s From Social Media
content: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon said a proposal to ban children under the age of 16 from social media will be part of the government’s work program, increasing its chances of becoming law.

title: OpenAI, Microsoft in Talks to Reset High-Stakes Partnership: FT
content: OpenAI and Microsoft Corp. are revising the terms of their partnership that will enable the ChatGPT maker to go public at a future date while preserving the software giant’s access to artificial intelligence technology, the Financial Times reported Sunday.

title: Apple’s 2027 Product Blitz Can’t Come Soon Enough
content: Apple is planning a monumental year for new devices in 2027, but its current lack of breakthrough designs could make that wait feel interminable. Also: The company is working on an iOS 19 feature that syncs hotel Wi-Fi access details across devices, and it’s preparing for an era after Google search.

title: CATL to Bar Some US Funds From World’s Biggest Listing of 2025
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., the world’s largest maker of batteries for electric vehicles, is planning to limit the types of US investors that can participate in its Hong Kong listing, an indication that US-China tensions may be spilling into the IPO market.

title: Parker Conrad’s Rippling Fortune Crosses $2 Billion With New Funding
content: Rippling, a human resources and payroll startup, has raised $450 million at a valuation of $16.8 billion — a deal that brings the value of the stake of its leader, Parker Conrad, to about $2.3 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

title: Whoop Reverses Course After Customer Backlash on Upgrade Fees
content: Whoop Inc., the maker of popular screen-less fitness bands, rolled back some aspects of a new hardware-upgrade policy that had drawn backlash from subscribers who were expecting to receive the newest devices for free.

title: Canadian Telecom Firms Blame Immigration Policies for Mobile Subscriber Slowdown
content: For years, Canada’s top telecom providers rode a wave of high immigration, collectively adding hundreds of thousands of new mobile phone subscribers most quarters. Those days are over.

title: Elton John, Dua Lipa Urge UK to Rethink AI Copyright Plans
content: Top UK artists, including Paul McCartney, Elton John and Dua Lipa, urged Prime Minister Keir Starmer to strengthen copyright protections ahead of a critical vote on rules governing artificial intelligence next week.

title: US and China Step Back From Decoupling Brink
content: I’m Katia Dmitrieva, an economics reporter in Hong Kong. Today we’re looking at US small businesses and tariffs. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Hungary Freezes Some Spending After Budget Gap Hits $8 Billion
content: Hungary’s government deficit rose to a record through April as interest payments outpaced tax income growth, leading the government to announce a spending freeze in parts of the budget.

title: The Polite Ways Companies Say Trump Tariffs Hurt
content: One of the remarkable things emerging from President Donald Trump’s tariff wars is a rebirth of the art of the polite slight. Or the “thanks but no thanks, sir” in the coded messages companies and industry lobbyists are putting out in public statements and submissions to government requests for comment about forthcoming tariffs. Dive into some and ignore your modern surroundings and you could be forgiven for thinking you are reading historical letters layered in ceremony, protocol and plenty of

title: Low-Income US Families Face Growing Gap Between Earnings, Costs
content: There’s a growing gap between what low-income families earn and what it actually costs to live in the US, according to a new study that says headline measures of inflation fail to capture the burden on these households.

title: US, China to Slash Tariffs in Step Back from Decoupling Brink
content: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products in a dramatic ratcheting down of trade tensions that buys the world’s two largest economies three months to work toward a broader agreement.

title: BOE’s Lombardelli Voted to Cut Rates as ‘Insurance’ Against Trade Wars
content: Bank of England Deputy Governor Clare Lombardelli said growth in UK wages and services prices is still too high to be consistent with bringing inflation back to the 2% target but she voted to cut interest rates last week to provide “insurance” against the risk of an economic slowdown caused by global trade wars.

title: IMF Plans Kenya Debt Scrutiny to Weigh Funding Needs in New Deal
content: The International Monetary Fund plans an in-depth review of Kenya’s debt to determine the nation’s financing needs under a new program.

title: ECB to Cut by More as Inflation Undershoots 2%, Poll Shows
content: The European Central Bank will lower borrowing costs more than previously expected this year to below 2% as inflation is seen undershooting the institution’s target in early 2026, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg.

title: SNB’s Brief Era of Positive Rates May Be About to End
content: The Swiss National Bank will probably cut its interest rate to zero in June after less than three years in positive territory, according to a Bloomberg survey.

title: Global Stocks Climb After US, China Agree to Cut Tariffs for 90 Days
Japan’s Merchants’ Mood Hits Worst in Three Years on Tariff Woes
content: Sentiment among Japanese merchants sank to the lowest in more than three years, underscoring deepening concerns over the economic outlook at home and abroad as the impact from US tariffs begins to filter into the economy.

title: US and China Tout Progress in Trade Talks, Offer Few Details
content: The US and China both reported “substantial progress” after two days of talks in Switzerland aimed at de-escalating a trade war, marking what Chinese Vice Premier He Lifeng called “an important first step” toward resolving differences.

title: Swedes’ Housing Optimism Weakens With Lower Consumer Confidence
content: Optimism among Swedes over the direction of home prices is waning as the Nordic country continues to grapple with economic headwinds and the prospect of slowing growth.

title: Africa’s Eswatini Kingdom Plans $275 Million Wealth Fund
content: The southern African Kingdom of Eswatini plans to start a sovereign wealth fund of around 5 billion emalangeni ($275 million) this year to help channel money into areas including manufacturing and agriculture, its finance minister said.

title: Japan Rules Out Trade Deal With US That Excludes Auto Tariffs
content: Japan won’t accept any initial trade agreement with the US that excludes an accord on autos, according to Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.

title: Americans Embrace Road Trips as Economic Fears Discourage Flying
content: Kristin Herman and her partner had been planning a European getaway with stops in Paris and Rome, but with the US economy suddenly wobbling, the couple instead drove to Oregon’s nearby redwood forests and Cannon Beach — even camping some nights to save on hotels.

title: Japan Bank Deposits Rise at Slowest Since ’07 as Inflation Bites
content: Japan’s bank deposits increased at the slowest pace since April 2007 as households seek to safeguard their assets from inflation.

title: Japan’s Sputtering Economy Likely Stalled Before Trump’s Tariffs
content: Japan’s economy likely suffered a contraction in the first three months of this year, signaling underlying fragility even before US tariff measures started hitting the country in earnest, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg.

title: US-China Trade Talks to Boost Sentiment in Asia, Strategists Say
content: “Substantial progress” made in US-China trade relations after two days of talks in Switzerland is likely to boost sentiment in Asia, according to some strategists, while others were awaiting further details.

title: US Ambassador Says Canada Tariffs May Not Be ‘Totally Removed’
content: Some US tariffs on Canadian imports may remain in place even as the relationship between the two countries improves, Peter Hoekstra, the US ambassador to Canada, said.

title: US Inflation Starting to Stir as Trump Tariff Threat Looms
content: US consumer prices probably picked up in April after the smallest advance in nine months, foreshadowing a broader acceleration as many companies seek to pass on higher tariffs.

title: Traders Eye Longer-Term Options to Hedge Post-Tariff Shock Rally
content: As April’s volatility storm fades into memory, traders are left balancing calmer markets and the ever-present risk of a fresh round of headline shocks.

title: Trump Hails Progress as US-China Negotiators Resume Trade Talks
content: Senior US and Chinese negotiators resumed on Sunday high-stakes talks to de-escalate their trade war, with President Donald Trump calling the hours-long discussions held a day earlier a “very good” meeting.

title: Trump Says ‘Much Agreed to’ in Meeting With Chinese Officials
content: President Donald Trump said US and Chinese negotiators in Switzerland had “a very good meeting” in an effort to de-escalate their trade war.

title: ECB’s Vujcic Expects Inflation to Slow to 2% Target by Year-End
content: Consumer-price growth will hit the European Central Bank’s 2% target by the end of 2025, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic.

title: UK Chancellor Reeves Set to Review ISAs Within Weeks, FT Reports
content: The UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is preparing to launch a review of the market for Individual Savings Accounts within weeks, the Financial Times reported Saturday.

title: Spain Is Said to Back Sabadell Tie-Up to Counter BBVA Deal
content: The Spanish government is open to considering a tie-up for Banco Sabadell SA with another domestic bank as a way to counter the unsolicited bid from BBVA SA, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Polestar Trims Losses on Cost Cuts, Sales of High-Margin Models
content: Polestar Automotive Holding’s losses narrowed in the first quarter as the electric-vehicle maker sold more of its newer models and cut costs.

title: Trump Vows US Drug Price Cuts of Up to 80% in Industry Blow
content: President Donald Trump said he plans to order a cut in US prescription drug costs by mandating that Americans pay no more than people in countries that have the lowest price.

title: Lilly’s Zepbound Trims More Belly Fat Than Novo’s Wegovy
content: Eli Lilly & Co.’s obesity drug Zepbound helped people trim about two inches more off their waists than Novo Nordisk A/S’s Wegovy in the first head-to-head study of the rival medicines.

title: Former StanChart Dealmaker Sets Up Abu Dhabi-Based Advisory Firm
content: A former banker at Standard Chartered Plc is launching a boutique advisory firm in Abu Dhabi, aiming to tap into the growing stream of institutional capital flowing between Asia, Europe and the Gulf.

title: UniCredit’s Profit Hits Record as CEO Orcel Pursues Deals
content: UniCredit SpA posted its highest quarterly profit ever, strengthening Chief Executive Officer Andrea Orcel’s hand as he pursues potential acquisitions.

title: EDP Says It’s Confident US Will Keep Tax Credits for Renewables
content: Portuguese utility EDP SA is confident that tax credits for renewable projects in the US will remain in place under the administration of President Donald Trump, Chief Executive Officer Miguel Stilwell d’Andrade said.

title: China’s Record Copper Ore Imports Offer Relief Amid Shortage
content: Chinese copper concentrate imports climbed to nearly 3 million tons last month, a record that’s likely to ease price pressures in the domestic market and offer relief to smelters fighting over the availability of feedstock.

title: Toyota Faces Biggest Hit From Trump Tariffs Among Automakers
content: Toyota Motor Corp. is the biggest carmaker in the world — and also the auto industry’s biggest loser when it comes to projected losses from US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: US Halts Cattle Imports Via Southern Border Over Screwworm Pest
content: The US said it is suspending imports of live cattle, horse, and bison via ports along the southern border because of the spread of the screwworm pest in Mexico.

title: Duffy Says ‘Several Weeks’ of Flight Cuts Needed at Newark
content: US Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said that Newark airport would see “several weeks” of reduced capacity as officials grapple with spiraling delays and safety lapses at one of the country’s busiest hubs.

title: Harvard Freeze, Funding Cuts Add to Headaches for Biotech CFOs
content: Executives fear they will have a harder time raising capital. Plus, BHP CFO Vandita Pant talks about capex, M&A and debt targets.

title: Aramco Profit Drops With Weak Oil Signaling More Strain
content: Saudi Aramco reported a decline in profit in the first quarter as lower crude prices put pressure on the finances of the world’s biggest oil exporter.

title: Cutting Newark Flights Is Temporary Fix for Long-Term Crisis
content: Airline chief executives are poised to work with US aviation officials to throttle back more Newark airport flights, a fix that may ease short-term safety concerns but won’t solve long-term challenges.

title: Canadian Telecom Firms Blame Immigration Policies for Mobile Subscriber Slowdown
content: For years, Canada’s top telecom providers rode a wave of high immigration, collectively adding hundreds of thousands of new mobile phone subscribers most quarters. Those days are over.

title: A Republican Senator Puts on His Big-Boy Pants
content: And we also have to give the House Republican moderates some credit (for now).

title: Conservative Host Scorched For Setting The Bar 'Extremely Low' On Trump
content: Ben Ferguson called for the president to get more "credit" for his take on a "nonpartisan issue."

title: Rove, founded by a 22-year-old, is helping Gen Z earn airline miles without credit cards
content: During his junior year study abroad, Max Morganroth, traveled to 30 countries, primarily flying in business and first class. His jet-setting was funded

title: Crime is down in American cities. Will Trump take credit?
content: “If you’re under 55, this is probably the safest moment you’ve ever lived in.”

title: Is credit card debt forgiveness smart for seniors? Here's what experts think.
content: Debt forgiveness can provide relief for some seniors, but it's important to know when it is and isn't a wise move.

title: Trump slams Newsom after California governor proposes federal film tax credit to "Make America Film Again"
content: President Trump slammed Gavin Newsom on Tuesday, just hours after the California governor asked for collaboration on a massive national film tax credit.

title: Credit Suisse to pay $511M for helping Americans evade $4B in taxes
content: Credit Suisse has pleaded guilty to criminal charges and agreed to pay $511 million for helping wealthy Americans hide more than $4 billion.

title: The AP Will Not Change Nick Ut's Credit on 'Napalm Girl' Photo
content: The AP has released an extensive report looking at whether Nick Ut is the author of the Vietnam War Napalm Girl image.

title: Royal Credit Union partnering with local non-profits for diaper drive
content: Donations will be accepted between May 1 and May 31, 2025.

title: Newsom suggests tax credit for Hollywood after Trump proposes tariffs on foreign films
content: California Gov. Gavin Newsom reached out to the Trump administration on Monday with hopes that the two can pair up and create a $7.5 billion federal film tax credit to help out the movie business.

content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.
